newsitem.title: GERMANY: Premiere says Kirch to sell 12.5 pct to CLT-UFA.
newsitem.headline: Premiere says Kirch to sell 12.5 pct to CLT-UFA.

text.p: Germany's Kirch Group, which on Wednesday bought an additional 37.5 percent stake in pay-television broadcoaster Premiere, will sell one third of that stake to Bertelsmann affiliate CLT-UFA, Premiere said.
The transaction is part of a deal between Kirch and CLT-UFA announced last week to split control over Premiere 50-50.
Bertelsmann and Canal Plus each held 37.5 percent of Premiere, and Kirch 25 percent. After the complex share deal, CLT-UFA and Kirch will each hold 50 percent.
Canal Plus agreed to sell the shares to Kirch while it acquired Kirch's 45 percent stake in Italy's Telepiu.

Telecommunications giant Deutsche Telekom AG, which operates Germany's only nationwide cable television network, said earlier it had reached a deal with Kirch and CLT-UFA to launch digital television in Germany.
The three will participate in a venture that developed the basic decoder technology.
